content: magic tiles blanket by brenda brayfield finished size 32 x 32 /81 cm x 81 cm materials dk yarn 1 155 m/1432 yds for 81 sqs shown in sirdar baby crofter shade 0177 7 balls sirdar baby crofter 165m/179 yds 1 ball sirdar snuggly dk for i-cord border or similar weight yarn one square is approx 9 cm/3 1/2 and uses approx 11 m/12 yds needles squares 3 75 mm/us 5 i-cord 2 4 00 mm/us 6 dpn s gauge 22 sts = 10 cm / 4 in stockinette stitch the blanket can be made with any weight yarn use the needle size recommended on the ball band magic tiles is knit modular this means the squares are knitted together by picking up and knitting stitches from the previously worked square no sewing required begin by casting on an odd-number of sts a central double decrease cdd runs diagonally down the middle creating the appearance of two triangles the square can be made as small or as large as you wish instructions included on page 7 for different size options the pattern square is worked over 35 sts and measures approx 9 cm / 3 1/2 the blanket can be planned or scrappy and can be made with one two or a variety of colours the blanket can be made any size simply stop knitting when it is the size you want use the chart on page 7 to plan a multi-coloured blanket alternate pattern the square can also be worked in garter stitch knit every row this option would be a good choice for a bulky yarn size option a slightly smaller rectangular blanket is the perfect size for child s car seat or stroller 6 sqs x 8 sqs or 7 sqs x 9 sqs would be good choices 1 magic tiles blanket © brenda brayfield 2006 updated 2020 for personal use only trouble shooting tips use contrast wool or a locking stitch marker to identify the rs of square a the centre decrease is worked every rs row the marker will confirm if you are on a rs decrease row odd-numbered row or a ws row even-numbered row remember the set-up row the stitch count will always be an odd number make a colour chart if you are using more than one colour with a planned layout page 7 read all the instructions from start to finish before starting a new square orient the blanket correctly before casting on a new square position square a with the center diagonal going from bottom right corner to top left it s easy to turn the blanket and go sideways you will only pick up and knit stitches on a side with slip stitches chained loops a purl bump along the slip_stitch edge indicates the last stitch was knit and not purled continue to pick up and knit into this stitch it is not as attractive as the slipped sts but it is on the wrong side and with 80
